WRITING.TITLE: Today #8217;s haul for $48

WRITING.TEXT: I checked on their twitter and so far it seems that they do not have the home video rights for this release, only for a theatrical run. It seems so odd though to do a restoration like that and not have it be in preparation for the added income of a physical release. Maybe they are still in negotiations and just can #8217;t confirm it yet? I hope that #8217;s the case, because I would love to upgrade all my Satoshi Kon films.

I pick up used criterion DVDs at my local record shop for $1-$4 to see if I like the film. This isn #8217;t super common, but I can pick up a few titles a month. Otherwise, I go with blu ray. It #8217;s just superior audio and visuals. If I really love a dvd I got, I #8217;ll upgrade to blu ray.

WRITING.TITLE: Yesterday #8217;s used record store haul, a nice Tuesday

WRITING.TEXT: Whoah, that is an impressive array of steelbooks! Nice.

I finally read the first three volumes of **Silver Spoon** and I love this series so much. Also read the first volume of **Delicious in Dungeon**, very much enjoyed it. I just got a pretty big delivery from Rightstuf's Yen press sale so there's a lot more to read this week! :D

Usually when a new series is announced, I'll read a few chapters online. If I like those, I'll order the physical release for the first volume and go from there. If I don't like the online chapters, I drop it. Otherwise, I always wait and get the physical release. I feel like I get a way more enjoyable experience with a physical release vs digital.
Ah nice, a lot of these are blind buys for me including Miss Pettigrew. Glad to hear it #8217;ll be a nice watch.

WRITING.TITLE: Picked up some blind buys today!

WRITING.TEXT: Wow, this is an amazing idea! I never use my digital codes, I gotta try this.
I use My Movies, and I don't think it limits your scans, I scanned probably 200 titles into it in one night when I first got it.

WRITING.TITLE: Crazy good finds today at the used record shop! Most for $4. Tuesday keeps being lucky.

WRITING.TEXT: Clue, Under the Skin and the classic comedy DVD came from amazon. Everything else was a total surprise.

WRITING.TITLE: Another Tuesday haul from the record shop. A few blind buys, classics, and my two first 4Ks!

WRITING.TEXT: I'll definitely keep an eye out for them, I still have to get a 4k player though. Currently I play all my DVD and Blu Ray on my PS4. I do have a 4K tv, so the player is the last component.
It's the BEST! Between the $1 DVDs and great selection of take ins, I think my collection has tripled since I discovered them.

WRITING.TITLE: An end of the week pickup at the used record shop!
Yesterdays traditional Tuesday haul from the record shop! Most were $5 or less.

WRITING.TEXT: There might be more copies, I did see some doubles in the new movies.
Yeah, there were a few months when they weren't getting new stock as frequently but lately it's just constant. I don't complain, but the wallet does.

WRITING.TITLE: Made a mistake and went back to the record shop. Found even more stuff! Most were $5 or less.

WRITING.TEXT: What player did you get?

WRITING.TITLE: Picked up some used Criterions for $16 or less at a record shop sale! These were largely blind buys so hopefully I picked some good ones.
Went to a new record shop for their annual sale. The used movies were 20% off. Found some fun items!

WRITING.TEXT: Great! Yeah, this and one other film were all that was left of the box set, it was really too bad :(

WRITING.TITLE: Found an extremely out of print box set for 99 cents. A few of the discs have scratches, gonna have to check this weekend to see if it plays through.
Pickups from this week, both Best Buy purchase and record shop finds. Record shop blu rays averaged around $4 a piece and a new 4K movie!

WRITING.TEXT: What kind of price range are you thinking?
Seems like something similar happened with The Death of Stalin, only got a DVD and digital release in the US. Gotta import it from the Uk to get a blu ray release :(

WRITING.TITLE: Another great Tuesday used movie haul from the record shop! Indiana Jones set was $9 everything else was $6 or under.

WRITING.TEXT: Well it #8217;s one of those nice digibook releases and has a good presentation so I like it. I only paid $6 so I guess it depends on what your budget is if it #8217;s worth it. It #8217;s very OOP on amazon, but you can still find it for a reasonable price on eBay I think.
Whoah, that's an amazing haul!

WRITING.TITLE: Amoeba Records used to price all of their used Criterion for $25 or more, but it seems that they have recently re-evaluated that policy, or at least since I last visited. Went last night and a lot of the used blu rays have been repriced to $15. Will post my finds a little later. They had good stuff!

WRITING.TEXT: The one I went to last night was the LA one, and they had a pretty good selection at $15, I thought. Some of the more common sellers were def $25 but a lot of great stuff was $15.

WRITING.TITLE: Here #8217;s the titles I picked up from Amoeba LA for $15 a piece. I think it was a good deal since a lot of them had been repriced from $25. Hopefully I picked some good titles, about half of these are blind buys.

Last weeks pickups. I went a little crazier than usual, but it was my first time to Ameoba in awhile and I managed to find a few good deals. Most are blind buys I #8217;ve wanted to see for awhile so hopefully I found some good stuff!

WRITING.TEXT: Where? I #8217;ve been having a hard time finding any used criterion blu rays under $15
Woah! I used to watch this on VHS as a kid. Totally forgot about it.
I just recently rebought Kaze Hikaru after having sold it when I moved. Love it so much.
Loving that Howling steelbook.

WRITING.TITLE: Traditional Tuesday haul at the record shop. Everything except Black Sails was brand new and $4-$6. Hope I got some good stuff as most of these shows and movies are blind buys.

WRITING.TEXT: I try to watch a new movie a day, but sometimes that gets to be too much so I need to take a break. I think I'll probably never completely catch up at this rate. Slowly but surely haha

Yeah, I'm probably hovering around the 65/70% area right now unfortunately. There've been too many good deals lately because it seems like more people than ever have been liquidating their collections. I've beefed up my blind buys a lot in the last few months.
It #8217;s one of the movies I #8217;ve actually seen in this haul. I agree, Kate is too fabulous, and I just love the razor sharp wit in the dialogue.

WRITING.TITLE: Small pickup with one of my favorite TV shows. I didn #8217;t even know they sold it on DVD. Gotta get the first two seasons now!

WRITING.TEXT: Welcome to the club!

WRITING.TITLE: Found a couple anime gems at a nearby record shop. Most of them were $4, and excited to add a few more digibooks to the collection.

WRITING.TEXT: Haha, thanks
Thanks! I #8217;m so excited to watch Tank Police again. The opening is one of my favorites and the first two episodes are some of the best in old school anime.

I #8217;m very encouraged with the love for Coupling. Really underrated here in the states I feel. The first two seasons I got were still shrink wrapped together brand new for $4, and it had the original tower records price tag on them for $54. Crazy it used to be so expensive.
I really like the extra attention for a release. There were so many cool collectors editions for DVDs, seems like the digibook is the closest comparison for blu ray.

WRITING.TITLE: Checked out two new second hand/ record shops and found a few spooky additions to the collection. The majority of these cost about $2.50, which was nice!

WRITING.TEXT: I live in the LA area. I recently got some time off work so I #8217;ve been going to a bunch of places I don #8217;t normally have the time to visit. I got way too much stuff D:

Haha, yep! Game Dude and Freakbeat records for this one. Only three came from Freakbeat though. Most are from Game Dude. I like the prices at Game Dude, but sometimes the cases aren #8217;t in the best shape so you gotta really inspect them before you buy.

It #8217;s the only place I know that #8217;s like that! It #8217;s terrible on my eyes. Drives me nuts because I know I #8217;m missing stuff because I can #8217;t make out the label and just move on.

Ameoba records has some used criterion #8217;s for $15. Another place that has a lot is a place called CD Trader. However, unless they are having a sale the used price is generally around $20, but they #8217;ve been adjusting the price on their movie stock recently so the prices might go down? Not thrift stores, but they have a variety of titles.

WRITING.TITLE: Had a little bit of luck at Ameoba records! Also a few new films from Amazon.

WRITING.TEXT: I go to Atomic usually twice a week. They are probably my favorite record shop. Tomorrow I #8217;m posting what I got there last Tuesday. They #8217;ve had way too much good stuff these last few months. Porto #8217;s is excellent, I agree.
Aw man, hope you didn #8217;t have to move too far away to stop visiting entirely. They are both so good. : #8217;(
Nooooooo. I #8217;m sorry, that #8217;s rough. Hope there #8217;s some good stuff where you are now!

WRITING.TITLE: Finds from last weeks traditional Tuesday trip to Atomic Records. Someone got to the copy of hereditary literally a few seconds before I did. : #8217;( All well, next time!

WRITING.TEXT: It #8217;s the best!
I #8217;m so annoyed that this didn #8217;t get a blu ray release in the states. :(

WRITING.TITLE: A small haul from last Friday at Atomic Records.

WRITING.TEXT: I highly recommend it! All the DVDs in the pick, aside from the Venture Bros., were $1 as well. They get a lot of really interesting stuff.

WRITING.TITLE: Haul from Game Dude. Probably 70% of these were $2.50, which I think is pretty good. The Frank Sinatra collection came from Amazon. Too many movies, too little time.

WRITING.TEXT: Memories is a fabulous Anthology. I think Satoshi Kon wrote the space one. Really amazing animation.
Thanks! It includes: On the Town, Anchors Aweigh, Robin and the 7 Hoods, Guys and Dolls, and Oceans 11.
Yup!
Lol, they are used. I almost never buy movies new anymore because there #8217;s at least four really great used shops within 30min drive radius.
Not this release, it #8217;s actually a steelbook that I think was released by Sony in 2014.
Yeah! I totally forgot they had movies. Some cases aren #8217;t in the best shape but you can #8217;t beat a lot of the prices.
Oh I didn #8217;t know that, what #8217;s wrong with it exactly?

WRITING.TITLE: Haul from record shop, CD Trader. They repriced a ton of their used Blu Rays so most of these were $4. Was very excited to find a copy of The Incredibles with the old cover for under $15. Really don #8217;t like the current one, and the old one has been extremely difficult to track down for a good price.

WRITING.TEXT: Yes, it #8217;s on Ventura. I actually don #8217;t know on the 4Ks because they didn #8217;t have any I could see for sale, but they might just have them located somewhere else. I didn #8217;t ask because I #8217;d found enough movies and didn #8217;t need the temptation. I did see a couple behind the counter that they were gonna put out though.

I #8217;m not 100% sure because they repriced the whole section for the most part, but they may have been just trying to clear stock. I don #8217;t think brand new intakes will be that cheap. They do reprice blu rays that have been their awhile over time, maybe they just did it all at once.
The B amp; N sale is in store. If you have the membership you can get your discount only on in store purchases I think.

WRITING.TITLE: Pickups from Atomic Records for the week, and an anime from online. Those are some LONG LEGS Footlight Parade.

WRITING.TEXT: Yeah! Definitely looking forward to seeing it again. Per the website, the soundtrack is a newly-recorded score by the Mont Alto Motion Picture Orchestra, adapted largely from the works of traditional Russian composers.
I have some Junji Ito (Tomie, Dissolving Classroom, and Fragments of Horror) as well as the first volume of Goodnight Pun Pun available.
https://imgur.com/a/ZpFyvUC Tomie is brand new, read once. I was thinking $25 shipped if that works?
Here ya go! https://imgur.com/a/OCpBZlQ I could do 22 shipped for Tomie. Also, are there any other series or books you #8217;re looking for? I have a bunch of manga I #8217;m writing up a post for.
Cool! I have images of the books I #8217;m selling here: https://imgur.com/a/XO4I04K I have Handa-Kun 1-7 if you #8217;re still looking for that one. Let me know if you see anything interesting.

WRITING.TITLE: Most recent haul from CD Trader and Game Dude. I had some store credit so the good times rolled. I took a chance on Take Shelter cause the disc has scratches but it #8217;s OOP. I #8217;ll see today if it plays.

WRITING.TEXT: Haha yeah.... it #8217;s a lot. I usually only do a pickup once or twice a week at most. Sometimes I don #8217;t even buy anything, but I got a break at work and went to a bunch of different shops the last few weeks. There just happened to be a bunch of cheap great stuff. I #8217;m still working on figuring out storage for my collection so it might be awhile for that unfortunately.

Thanks man! Excited to check out Kumiko. I #8217;ve heard great things about Take Shelter, but it #8217;s been extremely difficult to tack down a copy that #8217;s not $30. Hoping the light scratches won #8217;t effect play. Fingers crossed.
S #8217;all good! I #8217;m just looking at my piles of spoils, dreading having to figure out how to store them. The deals are a curse!
Nope! The 50% off sale is online and in store for everyone. The membership just gives you an additional discount for in store purchases.
I believe in you.

WRITING.TITLE: My flash sale purchases arrived! Excited to add these to the collection.
A haul from Game Dude, Amazon and Atomic Records. Always nice to add some animation and spooky films to the collection.

WRITING.TEXT: Yes, Game Dude is in Los Angeles. I don #8217;t think it #8217;s a chain though. As far as I know, it #8217;s just the one location.
Thanks! Colorful is awesome, I had it on DVD and was glad I was able to upgrade for a really reasonable price.

WRITING.TITLE: Final recent haul from CD Trader, Game Dude, and Amazon. Got some nice new animated films, musicals, and a few OOP titles!

WRITING.TEXT: Yes! I just wish I could get the rest of Satoshi Kon #8217;s films on blu ray.
It does. I #8217;m hoping since gkids was able to do a theatrical release of Perfect Blue, they might someday get the home video rights to the films. Time will tell I guess.
I haven #8217;t read it, just seen the movie. I #8217;ll have to check it out!
I #8217;ve heard really good things so I decided to blind buy it. Really excited to give it a watch. :)

Another option, instead of a binder, is using these plastic holders: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B014Q8XTZE?ref=yo_pop_ma_swf You can put them in these storage boxes: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B005XXGT7C?ref=yo_pop_ma_swf I have easily 200 movies per box and it also lets me save the artwork and inserts from the DVD case. I also have a binder, but I like being able to save the original covers easily.
Pmed
They had similar packaging on the screeners for the Netflix series Mindhunter. Only other time I've seen it.

Love all of Satoshi Kon #8217;s films. I really hope they get Blu Ray releases in the future. My personal favorite is probably Millennium Actress but I #8217;m also extremely fond of Tokyo Godfathers.

WRITING.TITLE: DVD purchases for last week, with most being $1.

WRITING.TEXT: Ah, I didn't realize it was that version of The Warriors. I actually wanted to compare the two versions so thats perfect. I haven't seen either version yet.

WRITING.TITLE: Some amazon purchases and a few finds at Atomic Records from last week. Bullhead is apparently OOP so pretty happy to find it!

WRITING.TEXT: Yep, it's in Burbank, near Portos. You can sometimes find some really cool stuff there.
Yeah! I was really surprised when I saw it. I think the only other drafthouse film I really want is Miami Connection and that one is still in print luckily.

There abouts, they can range from $3 to $6 for most movies. Some Box sets and criterions can be more. I got the complete Indiana Jones blu ray set for $9. But it all depends on what they get in, since they rely on what gets sold to them, they don't buy retail wholesale like Ameoba does.

WRITING.TITLE: Recent pickups from Game Dude and CD Trader. Was really happy to pick up some OOP digibooks for my collection!

WRITING.TEXT: Awesome! I'm trying to fill out my digibook collection so I'm really glad Mr. Smith is that great.
Great deal! Awesome selection

WRITING.TITLE: $1 DVD pickups from last week!
Some finds from my latest trip to CD Trader and Game Dude. Found a lot of nice digibooks for the collection!
My used criterion purchases for last week. Everything was between $10-$15, and there #8217;s an unintentional monochromatic theme with a dash of red!

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks! Most were from Ameoba Hollywood. I got Godzilla from a seller in this sub, and Fisher King I found at a place called Game Dude.
Haha, me too. I collect digibooks and since I knew one existed for Strangelove, I held off buying the Criterion. Glad to hear it #8217;s a great release!
Yup!

WRITING.TITLE: Latest pickups from online and Ameoba Hollywood. Criterions were $10-$15 and also found the Canadian edition of The Handmaiden!

WRITING.TEXT: Honestly, I just ordered it from their website, it #8217;s only $10 for the blu ray plus shipping. Way better than amazon prices! I also got the doc The Act of Killing and Trailer Wars.

It #8217;s been a really long time since I #8217;ve watched them, but I #8217;ve seen A Room with a View and Remains of the Day. Howard #8217;s End holds a special place in my heart though. I #8217;ve picked up a few more in my hauls in the last few months but haven #8217;t watched them yet. What are your favorites?
Haha, thanks. I keep telling myself to give it a rest, but I keep finding good deals.

WRITING.TITLE: A bunch of digibooks I #8217;ve been able to pick up recently! The collection grows more complete.

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks! I really enjoy the extra info in the digibooks releases. Seems like they don #8217;t really make them anymore which is a bummer.
eBay!
Awesome! It #8217;s a blind buy for me, so excited to check it out!
I have a similar problem. Too many good 2nd hand deals.

WRITING.TITLE: Latest pickups from Atomic Records for the last week or so. No DGs around so I have to make do!

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks! I haven't seen Buck Privates yet so I'm pretty excited to check it out :)
I love The Snowman, I watch it every year. A perfect winter classic.

WRITING.TITLE: Ameoba has smiled upon me! Cheapest I could buy these right now would be $250 for both. Just saved $200.

WRITING.TEXT: Oh yeah, I grabbed Fullmetal while it was still owned by Funimation too. I #8217;m always so sad when when a show I like gets licensed by Aniplex, since it is immediately out of my price range, unless I find it second hand. Got lucky this time, really want to own March Comes in like a Lion too someday. I really want to know just how many people actually are willing to pay Aniplex prices.

They usually have a day at the end of long sale periods where they offer all the one day sales together. I #8217;ve seen them do this the last few years for the Christmas sale, can #8217;t remember if they did for Black Friday too.

WRITING.TITLE: Pre-Black Friday pickups. From EBay and Amazon. Filling out more of the digibook collection.

WRITING.TEXT: Watch everything and then finish with Paddington 2 to bring your mood back up. It's the perfect feel good family film.
That #8217;s an amazing price for Pom Poko. Nice job!

WRITING.TITLE: Best Buy Black Friday (Thursday) haul. There #8217;s a few movies I #8217;m still waiting on, but was pretty happy I was able to get anything. The movie section was completely decimated at my local store. Almost completely empty when I went back midday Friday to return something.

WRITING.TEXT: 100% down with Muppet Treasure Island, the greatest film in the history of cinema.
Haha, that would be quite a night. I don't know if I'd have the strength.
I did not know that. Good fun fact!
Nice selection! I need to pick up that West Side Story one for myself.

WRITING.TITLE: Black Friday haul from CD Trader. They had a 20% off movie deal going so I bought some box sets I #8217;ve been meaning to for awhile!

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks! I don't really have a good place to take pictures unfortunately, but I try to make it as pleasing as possible. At least I'm consistent. lol
Awesome! That's a blind buy for me, looked very interesting.

WRITING.TITLE: Black Friday haul from Game Dude and CD Trader. Game Dude was 25% off blus. Was able to get some great prices. Criterion was $11, Fargo Season 1 less than $4!

WRITING.TEXT: Yup!
Thanks! One of my friends recommended it to me. Excited to check it out.

WRITING.TITLE: Second round haul from CD Trader #8217;s Black Friday sale! Plus one from Barnes and Nobles Criterion sale.

WRITING.TEXT: This one was $5 and I wanted to save a little bit.
Thanks! I actually haven #8217;t seen Naked yet but I decided to blind buy it on a friend #8217;s recommendation. I #8217;m also a big fan of David Thewlis, so excited to see more of his work.

Yeah I understand that, Dazed isn #8217;t an absolute favorite of mine, so I was ok with getting the cheaper release. If I can find the criterion for a really good price I #8217;ll definitely replace it though!
It genuinely made me laugh. It give gravitas to the bear.

WRITING.TITLE: Got the rest of my Black Friday/ Cyber Monday purchases from online, Amazon and Target. Amazon had a small coupon running so I was able to get some stuff I #8217;d had my eye on for awhile!

WRITING.TEXT: Seems like Planet Earth would be perfect for 4K!
Wow! That #8217;s an amazing deal! That digibook is one I #8217;m still looking for. Nice job!
Ah man, I couldn #8217;t actually figure it out, it was really random what it applied to. I had to go through my wish list and click on all the movies to see. Usually it was about 10%? It varied.
Yep! It #8217;s got a digibook and standard blu ray release.

WRITING.TITLE: Miscellaneous online/Amazon additions from the last few weeks and Black Friday/Cyber week. I thought I had finished with my hauls, but apparently I #8217;m a disaster of a human being and I forgot about this stuff. Bunch of digibooks for the collection.

WRITING.TEXT: Boys is still appropriate. Look at all those fancy lads.
The manga is pretty good! Nice that they included that.
I've had pretty good luck with Goo Gone on slip covers as long as the slip doesn't have any openings. Just make sure it doesn't go over the top edge, though it does dry out eventually.
They did that for the release of Warhorse. I believe that was Dreamworks.
I think it was about $9
These are my first purchases with them, so I #8217;m not too sure yet. I #8217;ve heard good things about their release of Belladonna in particular though.

WRITING.TITLE: My pickups from the trip to Amoeba I forgot to post the other week. It #8217;s a good place to find $15 Criterions these days. Also, rarer digibooks!

WRITING.TEXT: It was not new, they just shrink wrap it at the store to keep everything together for a lot of the digibooks. However, they had like three or four more copies and they had them all priced at $25. Much better than the current going eBay rate. Go get #8216;em!

It is used, they just reseal the digibooks that are too big for the anti theft plastic holders. However, they sometimes have new sealed ones too, just not blade runner. I actually haven #8217;t seen Secret Sunshine yet, but one of my friends really loved it and highly recommended it, so I thought I #8217;d check it out.

I agree they are definitely overpriced, but I can #8217;t really find them under $15 at stores so it #8217;s the best pricing I #8217;ve found not online. I basically just go through the blu rays and pull out the $15 titles and pick from there. Luckily they do have a really nice selection in that price range. The really popular ones are always $25 used, which is pretty annoying. I #8217;ve even found one for $10 before on a normally $40 film so sometimes you get lucky.
Thank you! I #8217;ve been meaning to watch it for a long time and forgot to when filmstruck was still around.

Are you at the Berkeley or LA one? I shop at the LA location so I wonder if there #8217;s a pricing difference? If you go to the LA one, just sift through everything, guaranteed you #8217;ll find like 10 or more $15 blu ray titles to pick from. Also, sometimes there #8217;s stuff underneath that #8217;s not up top.
Definitely do! I went there on Friday and picked up Man Escaped, Story of the Last Chrysanthemum, Topsy Turvy and Purple Noon. They also had If... and a few other classics on sale.
Oh no, they have really good prices on other movies I want too...

WRITING.TITLE: Atomic Records purchases from the week before Black Friday. Looking forward to the nostalgia trip that is The Muppet Movie!
Amazon Best of 2018 Anime Deal
WRITING.TEXT: [https://www.amazon.com/s/ref=gbph\_img\_m-2\_48f4\_283264a6?url=search-alias%3Daps amp;hidden-keywords=B0791WTKDS+%7C+B07921WMPW+%7C+B07D4ZLFXC+%7C+B077MQBZTW+%7C+B07FRLQ52V+%7C+B07BF24894+%7C+B07FRLQ52T+%7C+B077MYFXF7+%7C+B07BF681HH+%7C+B07D4ZPM35+%7C+B07BFB2SQZ+%7C+B077MYFLH2+%7C+B0791WTKDR+%7C+B07GRLPXL2 amp;smid=ATVPDKIKX0DER amp;pf\_rd\_p=78d819e7-dbb7-4ea8-820a-b8bffe3548f4 amp;pf\_rd\_s=merchandised-search-2 amp;pf\_rd\_t=101 amp;pf\_rd\_i=2921749011 amp;pf\_rd\_m=ATVPDKIKX0DER amp;pf\_rd\_r=SWH635QFXKZ5REAQ7THY](https://www.amazon.com/s/ref=gbph_img_m-2_48f4_283264a6?url=search-alias%3Daps amp;hidden-keywords=B0791WTKDS+%7C+B07921WMPW+%7C+B07D4ZLFXC+%7C+B077MQBZTW+%7C+B07FRLQ52V+%7C+B07BF24894+%7C+B07FRLQ52T+%7C+B077MYFXF7+%7C+B07BF681HH+%7C+B07D4ZPM35+%7C+B07BFB2SQZ+%7C+B077MYFLH2+%7C+B0791WTKDR+%7C+B07GRLPXL2 amp;smid=ATVPDKIKX0DER amp;pf_rd_p=78d819e7-dbb7-4ea8-820a-b8bffe3548f4 amp;pf_rd_s=merchandised-search-2 amp;pf_rd_t=101 amp;pf_rd_i=2921749011 amp;pf_rd_m=ATVPDKIKX0DER amp;pf_rd_r=SWH635QFXKZ5REAQ7THY) #8203; Looks like My Hero Academia Season 2 parts 1 and 2 are under $30 There also looks to be a 5% coupon for a lot of titles. Looks like mostly Funimation.
I went region free for Christmas; the benefits are just rolling in. Ironically my local record shop just had a used copy go up for sale for $75. Fair price, until I saw this!

WRITING.TITLE: Atomic Records got new stuff in! Most were $4, with DVDs being $1.

WRITING.TEXT: Thank you, I #8217;m really excited, it #8217;s been in my saved for later cart for years, but it never dropped below $20. So happy I finally got it for a reasonable price.
I #8217;m a huge fan of the manga, only seen a few episodes of the anime, but looking forward to finishing it :)
I was blown away as well, truly fantastic film!
You could look into getting a separate region free player.
Treat yo' self!
Perfect analogy
Snake eyes is fun. Saw it with a group of friends, great time.

Interesting placement of The Little Stranger. I got really excited about it when I saw the trailer and read up on the film, but when the reviews came in a felt really discouraged to see it. If I come across it for a good price, I #8217;ll definitely give it a chance!
Yes! I just need Millennium Actress and I'll be complete.
Please let this be true, it's my favorite movie of his.

WRITING.TITLE: Amoeba Hollywood haul from the other week. $15 criterions and a few other finds.

WRITING.TEXT: Yes, fabulous film. I was very happy to add it to my collection :)
Thanks! This is my last visit of the year from them, very happy I found some nice pieces.
Those are Oscilloscope #8217;s releases of We Need to Talk About Kevin and The Messenger.
Yeah, I found these two in the Drama section. I think they had another copy of The Messenger at least. Im pretty sure I saw one or two other films from them in that section too.
Man of a Thousand Faces
My sad SD copy of the theatrical cut of Amadeus. Keep coming back to it.
I think the remake did happen, it just sucked, so no one remembers it.

WRITING.TITLE: Really goods finds at atomic Records this past Tuesday! Really excited to add these to my collection.

WRITING.TEXT: Really great movie! I found it on DVD recently in a combo pack with the film Mouse Hunt.
Thanks! My friend actually found it first, but I traded him Ant Man and The Wasp for it. This set was a better price so it doubly worked out. No regrets!
Good tips, I just placed my first order might have to upgrade the shipping.

WRITING.TITLE: Got my Sentai sale shipment! Everything was so cheap, I couldn #8217;t believe it.

WRITING.TEXT: Loved Colorful. Really solid film!
By one letter

Nice! This was actually my first time buying things from Sentai directly so I definitely did some blind buys for shows I've been meaning to watch. My favorite thing was being able to complete my collection of Space Brothers for $5 a set.
I normally do the Rightstuf holiday sale, but I thought their deals were a little weak this year; very happy for the Sentai deals. I just never realized that you could buy directly from Sentai.
Amazing bargain! Wish there was pawn shops in my area, we just have record stores, but they know what criterions are worth lol. Definitely can #8217;t find deals like that!
The BeMerry coupon is online only I believe. The buy 2 get the third is in store and online.
My local record store recently had one listed for $75 and I thought that was reasonable, this is a great deal.
I was super happy with the Black Friday $6 price for season one. Hope they do a similar price for season 2 next year. $15 isn #8217;t too bad though!
I ordered the blu ray from the UK. I think it #8217;s only region 2 though so you need a region free option. Plus side, it #8217;s part of their 5 blu rays for 30 pounds deal.
Seems like Warner Brothers is going to do another limited release in February. So you have another chance!

I read it in a deadline article that came out today. It #8217;s only going to be released in the top 25 markets it sounds like, but it #8217;s another chance to see it. I saw it today and I would highly recommend it. PBS also has a three part American Experience series about world war 1, but it #8217;s very America focused. https://www.google.com/amp/s/deadline.com/2018/12/peter-jackson-they-shall-not-grow-old-box-office-record-1202526739/amp/

WRITING.TITLE: Pre-holiday pickup from CD Trader and Game Dude. Most of these were around $2.50 - $4 and I had some trade in credit as well. Very excited to get Secret of Kells at a decent price.

WRITING.TEXT: Yeah, get #8216;em! It was the last film of theirs I needed, since I had previously picked up the other two. Their stuff is just the best. Can #8217;t wait for their next film!

WRITING.TITLE: End of the year online purchases. Came from a few new blu ray purchasing websites, eBay and amazon.

WRITING.TEXT: Yes it is, the bottom five on the stack are digibooks. I got really lucky on the bottom three, only paid $2.50 a piece plus shipping.

Thanks! I used Oscilloscope, and bluraysforeveryone.com for this lot, in addition to Amazon and eBay. They were new for me this year. Pretty happy with them. I can also recommend Family Video as well!
Ameoba has a lot of Criterions for sale at $15. These tends to be the less popular titles, however I #8217;ve gotten some amazing films at that price.

If you want a local store, this place is probably 30min outside LA, but they have the best Criterion selection outside Barnes amp; noble and Amoeba. All their used criterion range between $16-$20 usually. It #8217;s nearly always $20 used. They usually tend to have a lot of box sets too. They also have criterions new, but I always grab their used stuff. It #8217;s called CD Trader and it #8217;s a small record shop in Tarzana. The guys that work there are pretty helpful too.

WRITING.TITLE: End of the year pickup at CD Trader. Looking forward to checking out Bone Tomahawk finally!

WRITING.TEXT: You have some great anime in there, awesome collection!
I #8217;m with you there! I got a ton of series during the Sentai sale this year. No idea where I #8217;ll find the time lol
Same here, just got the email. At least we tried.
I will gladly follow your advice
Indicator, from what I #8217;ve found, does one sale a year around Black Friday.

WRITING.TITLE: End of year haul from Game Dude. Had some store credit so got everything for $50!

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks for the heads up! I keep kicking myself because I saw it in the wild for $4 a few months ago, but I didn #8217;t know what it was yet. My friend bought it, lucky guy.
Thanks and you got me. You figured out the secret within the post. I applaud you, sir.

WRITING.TITLE: Films I got from online; got some great deals from eBay and a few other sites.

WRITING.TEXT: Thank you! Man, I wish I was a secret millionaire. I just have a relatively good job, and no self control when I see a good deal. I #8217;m really excited for these though since I got a region free player for Christmas! BFI #8217;s catalogue is open to me now :D
Nice! I just got my order from their sale yesterday. We are in the no self control club together.

WRITING.TITLE: Haul from my last Atomic Records run before the holidays happened. Super excited to have finally picked up I Saw the Devil!

WRITING.TEXT: What #8217;s this in reference to?
Oh good, I got worried for a min
Nice! There #8217;s some good stuff there. I wish there were pawn shops near me with blus
You could always use tape and paint if there aren't any blank ones available.
Warner Archive sale? I had a few other movies that were priority this time around, but I definitely gotta pick these up on the next sale!
You can #8217;t even buy the blu ray for Return to Oz. I think it #8217;s a Disney movie club exclusive. You can only get it second hand if your not a member. Nice!

WRITING.TITLE: A few more anime pickups from the holiday sales! Loved Made in Abyss and happy to get some classics!

WRITING.TEXT: Amazing price!

$3 is awesome too! It's nice when shops you frequent give you special treatment. My local record shop lets me look through stuff before it goes on the floor if they have any movies that havent been processed yet.
A classic of the old Toonami!
Thanks! Made in Abyss was a pleasant surprise for me this past year. Looking forward to more of it.

WRITING.TITLE: Got my first order of movies from the UK for my new region free player. So excited! I got these from eBay, still waiting on my amazon package. Also, two unrelated anime.

WRITING.TEXT: It #8217;s one of my favorites too. I also really love Millennium Actress, which I hope will someday see a blu ray release.
From what I read, the Japanese blu ray doesn #8217;t have subtitles. :(
Nice, I ended up paying around $21 for the set. I #8217;m not sure if that was a great price but it was better than what I saw on other shops.

Saw this over the holidays and it really made the first world war a much more immersive experience. Made me feel a much greater connection with the history. I wish they could do a longer documentary series focusing on the aspects of the war they didn #8217;t have the time to explore.
Satoshi Kon set with Paranoia Agent included.

WRITING.TITLE: Ordering movies from Amazon UK question
WRITING.TEXT: Hey all, I made an order with Amazon UK at the beginning of December and I just got an email that it had been returned without a specified reason, and that I will be receiving a refund. I live in the US and I was wondering what shipping option I should choose in the future? I #8217;m sure the holidays, combined with me choosing the cheapest shipping are to blame, my address and everything else was fine. Thank you for any advice.
Oh it was movies! Darn I forgot to include that. That #8217;s why I posted to this sub.
They had shipped it out, but it got returned for an unspecified reason so I don #8217;t think it was a limited stock thing.
Whoah! Amazing!!!
So jealous! I checked my area after your last post, found nothing that I would consider a good enough deal. :(

I collect digibooks and I like them because of the extra information and art/photos they provide. Some of them are also quite valuable once they go out of print. I love books though so digibooks is like the perfect in between item for me.
Way to get lucky!

WRITING.TITLE: Kino films I picked up during their last sale, and a few online purchases. Most of the Kinos were blind buys except for Judgement at Nuremberg. Hopefully I picked some good ones!
Went into Frys for an HDMI cable, left with these boys. Trying to expand my Korean and Asian film options.

WRITING.TEXT: There wasn't a sale, I had to also return something so I decided to pick out a few movies with my store credit. The Man from Nowhere was recommended to me by my friend so I'm very excited for that one.

WRITING.TITLE: Went to McKays for the first time while visiting family. Traded in some movies so got all of these for about $20. Awesome place!

WRITING.TEXT: I noticed that too on the pricing. However, I was extremely happy with amount they gave me for some of my old movies. Kind of made up for any high price tags!
Lu over the Wall is a complete joy to watch. Really interesting film!
Nice prices!

WRITING.TITLE: Went to my first FYE last month while on a family trip. Had some good end of year deals. Glad I got to go to one finally!

WRITING.TEXT: I went region free because I got so frustrated that Death of Stalin wasn't getting a US blu ray release. Have not regretted that decision.
Loved Lu Over the Wall. My Target had it on prominent display so I hope people give it a chance. Great pick ups!

WRITING.TITLE: Films I got in the latest Warner Archive sale. So excited to add my favorite comedies and classic films to my shelf!

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks!

It was back in early January. I #8217;ve just been busy with work and have a backlog of hauls to post. I #8217;m not sure how often they have the sales, but it should be two to three times a year. I think the sale is always a 4 films for $44 one. Not bad since the cheapest I #8217;ve ever found a used one used in the wild has been $6-$8, and they are rare for me to come across.

WRITING.TITLE: Arrow haul from back during their holiday sale. Very happy to have picked these up! About half of them are blind buys I #8217;ve had my eye on for awhile.

WRITING.TEXT: Whoah, I had no idea Mean Girls was OOP. I picked up a used copy for $2.50 last month. Nice.
Ohhhh, that #8217;s why the art looks like that, ok. That #8217;s kinda sweet Disney.

WRITING.TITLE: Got a few online orders from eBay. Expanding out the UK collection a bit more!

WRITING.TEXT: I keep my anime separate to help with organization. I also keep all my western animated films/TV shows in a different section. Different medium, different section to help keep things organized.
Maybe wait to see if it comes back in stock before your return window closes.

WRITING.TITLE: Some recent anime additions to the collection!

WRITING.TEXT: Notorious, Diabolique, and I haven #8217;t decided on the third movie yet.
WB archives does a few sales a year. I also follow them on Twitter to do my best to make sure I don #8217;t miss them.
Thanks! I #8217;ve been trying to watch more classics lately. Been a very long time since I #8217;ve seen most of these.

WRITING.TITLE: Some internet purchases over the last few months. Super excited for Sing Street!

WRITING.TEXT: You just have to wait, I'm sure around Black Friday, Into the Spiderverse will be going for $10. They always start high and then drop off for the most part. Kinda like PS4 games.
Me too, I watched it six months ago and it #8217;s become a favorite of mine.
Oh good to know! I #8217;ll add We are the Best to my list to look out for. I recently picked up Begin Again and Once. Thinking I might do a marathon.

Amazon fluctuates throughout the year though. After the holidays the prices go up and tend to stay up until the end of the year when they want to increase sales. You just have to wait and eventually a good price is likely to happen. I support my local record shops and find tons of great deals through them, but they don't have everything unfortunately.
I #8217;ve seen Chikamatsu and I really loved it. A really great love story with amazing historical detail and acting. I highly recommend it!

WRITING.TITLE: January finds from Atomic Records. The Criterion #8217;s were $15 a piece and everything else was $5 or less!

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks! My friend recommended I check out Game Night, looking forward to it.
Thanks! I hope Atomic keeps delivering. :)
Check out Kids on the Slope if you get the chance. Very interesting work of his.

WRITING.TITLE: January purchases from Amoeba Records and CD Trader and Game Dude. Always happy to find $15 Criterions and most of the other films were $2.50-$5!

WRITING.TEXT: Amoeba LA! It depends on the title for what #8217;s priced at $15. The most popular movies are usually $25 used.

WRITING.TITLE: Got an order from Amazon UK. Very excited I decided to go region free! The Death of Stalin not getting a US blu ray release was the final straw for me.

WRITING.TEXT: Usually if it's region free, it'll say so in the title of the film on Amazon. You might have luck just typing in 'Blu ray region free' and seeing what pops up.
I wish it wasn't out of print, it looks so cool!

WRITING.TITLE: February finds from Atomic Records! Most of these were $5 or less, with the Cohen movies all being under $10.

WRITING.TEXT: Burbank!
Thank you! I was young when I saw return of the joker and it scared me quite a bit, but I loved it. Super happy to revisit it.

WRITING.TITLE: Purchases from the previous Twilight Time sale, and a few other online finds!

WRITING.TEXT: I thought it was out of print so I was really surprised that it was available on screen archives #8217; website. I think it #8217;s low stock now though. I #8217;d buy it sooner rather than later in case it does go out of print.

WRITING.TITLE: Amazon and Amoeba Records finds from March! Most are blind buys except for Prince of Egypt and Colette. Hopefully I found some good stuff!

Used Criterion finds from the last few months. Atomic Records, CD Trader and Amoeba Music. CD Trader had an especially impressive amount available during their last sale, I had to put some back. Looking forward to watching them!

WRITING.TEXT: Ah, thanks for the advice! I haven't watched the New World yet so I'll make sure to watch that version.
Ooh, good to know. I know my mom wanted a copy of it, so it #8217;ll go to a good new home if it #8217;s too sad for rewatches.

WRITING.TITLE: My finds from last month #8217;s sale at CD Trader, everything 20% off. All the 4Ks were still shrink wrapped. Super excited to snag a copy of Osmosis Jones! Hoping it gets a blu ray release someday.

WRITING.TEXT: One of my favorites from last year, so much fun to watch
That one was a blind buy based on the cast and summary. Looking forward to watching it!
Yes! Been waiting for curse of the Were-Rabbit for forever.

WRITING.TITLE: Found a white whale this past record store day! Still sealed and was also 10% off. Never thought I would find a copy out in the wild.
